To top to all off it was pouring rain outside and we had a big group of people and a worker took a huge outside umbrella and walked us about 6 blocks to the subway!!!!! ABSOLUTELY TO DIE FOR

    1
    8/19/2021

    My friends and I visited this place on vacation from Chicago. It had a great brick-oven pizza we shared and tasty Alfredo and Scampi dishes. The venue has moody lighting and there was live music. It was a good experience and made Little Italy memorable for us.

  • Anna S.

    Elite 2021

    Sunnyvale, CA
    309
    78
    42
    9/12/2021

    We had a mixed experience here and I don't see myself coming back.

    We got a table right away at 7pm on a Friday night and started with appetizers. The mozzarella sticks and bruschetta were delicious. The Caesar salad was good, except the anchovies were insanely salty so we had to push them to the side of the plate.

    I got carbonara and it was alright, I have definitely had better. My friend had the meatballs and said it was just okay. She didn't even want to take them home. My other friend had the spinach ravioli and also said they were just fine, nothing special. My friends had the special ravioli with an assortment of lobster, spinach, and some other kind of ravioli in vodka sauce and they thought it was pretty decent. My bf had the cacio de Pepe and it was horrible. It had probably 3x as much black pepper as it needed. I tried it and there were so many big chunks of black pepper everywhere. It was so overboard and unappetizing. Almost inedible.

    The wait staff was nice to us but we are pretty sure they completely forgot to put in our dinner order. We waited a good 30 minutes after our appetizers came for our entrees until we noticed tables who arrived after us were getting their food. I asked the waiter when our food will come and he looked nervous and simply said "soon". Our food came out 10 minutes later. Yeah I don't think he put in the ticket at all.

    Had high hopes but would not return sadly

  • Alden K.

    Elite 2021

    Morristown, NJ
    168
    580
    781
    8/29/2021
    1 check-in

    It was very meh chicken piccata, definitely not anywhere close to the best I've had in the area. The carbonara somehow tasted a little fishy to me, but to be fair my wife didn't notice that. She did notice chunks of egg in the sauce, which is either sloppy or incompetent at these prices.

    They kept our water full during the summer, which I greatly appreciate. Service was great, food was just worse than mediocre. They added an 18% tip during lunch. I think the waitstaff deserve 20% for their good service, even during lunch. If you charge me a tip, I appreciate you saving me the 2 seconds of math, but at least make it 20 percent.

  • Ginette P.

    Elite 2021

    New York, NY
    650
    1453
    9427
    8/18/2021
    7 photos

    Little Italy is an area that seems to have been well prepared for COVID since a lot of the restaurants already have outdoor dining. Taking a stroll through the area & these guys had a "frozen drinks bar" sign which caught our attention so we decided to give them a try.
    Drinks to start I had the Pomegranate martini & hubby had the Spirito Di Fragola , pomegranate was good taste wise , the spirito was better tasting but both lacked alcohol, I later switched to a Pinot hard to go wrong.
    They start u off w some toasted bread w olive oil, not bad nice tasting oil. Appetizer we had the Burrata w prosciutto very good, fresh mozzarella great w the tomatoes & arugula.
    Main dishes went with the Pomodoro pasta & the Zia Maria chicken w veggies, on the Pasta simple dish but very tasty sauce.. the Zia Maria chicken was delicious stuffed chicken breast with mozzarella , wrapped in prosciutto with a creamy gorgonzola sauce very good dish went well with the veggies which were mainly broccoli & carrots.
    These guys have a nice outside set up, decent looking inside as well. They offer freshly made pasta which is on display to watch, as well as gluten free option.
    Service was good a bit much having 3-4 people cater to you but understandable these days since not a lot of business. Price wise a bit on the pricey side but doable, we enjoyed our meal.

    See all photos from Ginette P. for Zia Maria-Little Italy

    Got to Little Italy too late for San Gennaro. Decided to stay for food, drinks and dessert. Stopped at Zia Maria. Granito is so personable and is the reason we stopped. Food -- excellent! Wish we had more than what we ordered! We will definitely be back!

    Cannoli and espresso

    Homemade Tiramisu

  • Sonali G.

    Elite 2021

    New York, NY
    110
    82
    94
    8/15/2021
    4 photos

    The staff at this place were all very excited and energetic. Very cheerful and welcoming.. almost a bit too over the top. Certainly a place for a younger crowd, not so much a family restaurant.

    The margarita pizza was good and the lobster ravioli was incredible. The ravioli was my favorite from this place. The pesto gnocchi was alright - it could use some more flavor.

    The birthday surprise was ... a lot. Very over the top and a little uncomfortable, especially with all the staff staring. Still not sure how I feel about this one.

  • Chloe S.

    Elite 2021

    Manhattan, NY
    338
    33
    36
    3/8/2021
    2 photos

    Great delivery! 4 stars because the pizza came cold, but was really impressed by the quality of the food (once reheated in the oven) as well as the value.

    We ordered the funghi pasta (subbed spaghetti for pappardelle), the chicken parm, and the margarita pizza (added meatballs and ricotta). The chicken parm was a standout for me, especially at the price. Really nice sized portions and delicious flavor.

    I'm always skeptical to order in pasta because I feel like it all tastes the same at a certain point, but I was really happy with this meal. Will definitely be ordering from here again!

    Zia Maria Margherita Pizza with meatballs and ricotta

    Chicken Parmigiana and Pappardelle al Funghi

Frequently Asked Questions about Zia Maria-Little Italy

Does Zia Maria-Little Italy take reservations?

Yes, you can make a reservation by picking a date, time, and party size.

Does Zia Maria-Little Italy have outdoor seating?

Yes, Zia Maria-Little Italy has outdoor seating.

Is Zia Maria-Little Italy currently offering delivery or takeout?

Yes, Zia Maria-Little Italy offers both delivery and takeout.

What forms of payment are accepted?

Zia Maria-Little Italy accepts credit cards.

Zia Maria-Little Italy is a Yelp advertiser.
